title: Gallery Talk: Bauhaus Chicago—Design in the City
title_display: Gallery Talk: Bauhaus Chicago—Design in the City
hero_caption: Edgar Bartolucci, Jack Waldheim. Barwa Lounge Chair, about 1950. Gift of Stanley Tigerman and Margaret McCurry.
short_description: Join exhibition curator Alison Fisher to explore Bauhaus Chicago: Design in the City and the connections between the seminal German school of art and design and the city of Chicago. Featuring works ranging from jewelry, photography, and textiles to furniture, monumental sculpture, and urban planning, the show includes pieces created by many instrumental teachers and talented students who shaped the 20th-century history of design and architecture at these schools and highlights the Bauhaus’s continuing legacy in Chicago and around the world.
